meanings.definition: To remove someone from a list of friends on a social networking website.
meanings.sent1: I had to unfriend someone who kept posting mean comments on my profile.
meanings.sent2: She decided to unfriend him after he betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent3: It's never easy to unfriend someone, but sometimes it's necessary for your own well-being.
meanings.sent4: In the virtual world, unfriending can be as impactful as slamming a door in someone's face.
meanings.sent5: The act of unfriending can feel like cutting a tie that was weighing you down.

meanings.definition: A person who is no longer a friend.
meanings.sent1: After the argument, she became an unfriend and walked away from the friendship.
meanings.sent2: He used to be my best friend, but now he's just an unfriend I used to know.
meanings.sent3: The unfriend didn't bother attending the party, showing how distant they had become.
meanings.sent4: Being labeled as an unfriend can sometimes be a wake-up call to reevaluate your actions.
meanings.sent5: The unfriend in the group was a reminder that not all relationships are meant to last.
